subskills.DESCRIPTION: Sort plants and animals into groups based on where they live (water, land, air)
Match baby animals to their parent animals using pictures
Identify and label the main parts of a plant (roots, stem, leaves, flower)
Draw and explain how animals use different body parts to move
Classify animals as herbivores, carnivores, or omnivores based on what they eat
Match different types of animal homes to the correct animals
Identify how different animals protect themselves (camouflage, spines, shells)
Sequence the growth stages of a familiar plant using pictures
Sort animals by their physical features (fur, feathers, scales)
Demonstrate how plants respond to light by conducting a simple experiment
Match seasonal changes in plants to the correct season
Identify and sort plants by leaf shapes and sizes
